intro: Zanthoxylum ekmanii, commonly known as the Ekman's prickly ash, is a deciduous shrub native to the mountainous regions of Mexico. It belongs to the Rutaceae family and is characterized by its spiny stems and opposite, pinnately compound leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are followed by red, fleshy berries. Zanthoxylum ekmanii is adapted to rocky and well-drained soils, often growing in forested or open habitats. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies in its native range.
